author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: Amidst the ongoing 'Operation Sindoor' against Pakistan, the Supreme Court has temporarily halted the discharge of 69 Short Service Commission Officers, including 47 women. The court emphasized the need to maintain morale during the Indo-Pak tensions, suggesting their skills could be utilized elsewhere. The decision follows arguments about discriminatory practices in granting Permanent Commissions, especially given recent rulings on women's eligibility.
title: ‘Don’t hit morale’: Not the time to release SSC officers, SC tells Army

author: AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY
title: Supreme Court quashes Delhi HC's Wikipedia takedown order

author: SAEED KHAN
title: Told to pay more than brother for mom’s care, man moves HC

author: AJAY SURA
title: Water row: Punjab chief secretary, DGP face contempt for defying HC order

author: ASMITA DEY
description: Amid rising India-Pakistan tensions, companies are taking precautions to protect employees and minimize operational impact. Dabur has adjusted factory hours in Jammu, while Nestle's Punjab factory continues normal operations. E-commerce firms are adjusting delivery timelines in border states, but distributors report sufficient stock levels, preventing widespread supply disruptions or panic buying.
title: Amid India-Pak tensions, WFH, manufacturing ramp-down at some companies

author: TNN
title: Attacks stonewalled, Pakistan may order terror strikes

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.0 strikes Pakistan

author: MAYUR SHETTY
title: Japan's SMBC to buy 20% in Yes Bank

author: RAUNAK BOSE
description: Angel Reese aims to lead the Chicago Sky to victory after a challenging rookie season marked by individual records but team struggles. Following an injury and significant roster changes, including a new coach and veteran additions, Reese is focused on expanding her game and contributing to a winning culture. She is determined to achieve championship aspirations.
title: Angel Reese eyes WNBA redemption - Can record-breaking rookie lead?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
title: Explained: Why India abstained instead of voting no on IMF Pakistan loan

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: The DGCA announced the temporary closure of 32 airports across northern and western India for civil flight operations from May 9 to May 14, 2025, resuming on May 15. The Airports Authority of India has also extended the closure of 25 Air Traffic Service routes within the Delhi and Mumbai Flight Information Regions.
title: 32 airports closed for civil flight ops till May 15: Govt

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: IMF approves $1 bn disbursement to Pak despite India's warning over terror funding

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Pak attempts to escalate again: Drones spotted at 26 locations near border

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Amidst India-Pakistan tensions, a viral message urged citizens to disable their phone locations, falsely claiming it aided population detection by drones. PIB Fact Check debunked this advisory as fake, clarifying that the government had not issued any such warning. Authorities cautioned against Pakistan-sponsored propaganda and urged citizens to verify information, especially concerning the Indian Armed Forces.
title: Pakistan drone attacks: Need to turn off location on phones- what govt says

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Trump wants India-Pak de-escalation, says White House after Vance's 'none of our business' remark

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A Pakistani drone struck Firozepur, Punjab, injuring three civilians, prompting hospital treatment and heightened security measures. This incident follows thwarted attempts to target Indian military infrastructure and numerous airspace violations along the LoC and International Border. India's air defense systems intercepted many drones, leading to precautionary blackouts in vulnerable areas to protect civilians and infrastructure from further attacks.
title: 3 injured in Ferozepur after Pakistani drone strike

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Amid escalating India-Pakistan border tensions, the IPL 2025 match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals in Dharamsala was abruptly halted on Thursday. The BCCI, prioritising safety, coordinated with Indian Railways to evacuate players and staff via a special train to Delhi. Consequently, the IPL 2025 season has been suspended for a week on Friday.
title: 'Bahut achcha tha': BCCI thanks Indian Railways for special train - Watch

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Mother's Day is a perfect time to express love and gratitude to the special women in our lives. A heartfelt message, whether lighthearted or sincere, can brighten her day more than any gift. Simple notes, borrowed quotes, or even a quick phone call can create lasting memories. Expressing appreciation improves well-being and strengthens connections, making this Mother's Day truly special.
title: Mother's day 2025: Best messages, quotes, wishes and images

author: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA
description: The Trump administration signals a hands-off approach to potential India-Pakistan conflict, deeming it "none of our business." While urging de-escalation, the US won't dictate terms, allowing India to manage regional affairs. New Delhi asserts its right to retaliate against Pakistan's alleged support for terrorism, presenting evidence of collaboration between Pakistani military and proscribed terrorists.
title: US gives India a free hand to manage Pak despite salutary advice to de-escalate

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India-Pakistan tensions: India has voiced strong concerns at the IMF's Executive Board meeting regarding bailout packages for Pakistan, citing its poor track record and potential misuse of funds for terrorism. India highlighted Pakistan's repeated reliance on IMF programs, questioning their effectiveness and the country's economic policies.
title: India flags Pak’s terror financing at IMF; abstains from bailout vote

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The Pakistan Cricket Board has postponed the 2025 Pakistan Super League indefinitely. This decision follows the relocation of matches from Pakistan to the UAE. Escalating military tensions with India prompted the move. The Emirates Cricket Board was willing to host. PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi expressed regret over the relocation. The safety of players and staff is the priority.
title: 'Pakistan Super League 2025 postponed indefinitely'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following escalating tensions, the 2025 IPL season is temporarily suspended, prompting teams to manage squad relocations. Overseas players are anxious, leading the BCCI and teams to expedite travel arrangements for them to return home. Delhi Capitals and Punjab Kings players have already arrived in Delhi after their Dharamsala fixture was halted, while other teams are making similar arrangements.
title: Watch: DC and PBKS players arrive in Delhi from Dharamsala

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: For 3rd night in a row, Pak attempts incursion: What we know so far

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Jordon Hudson, Bill Belichick’s girlfriend, has been banned from the University of North Carolina's football facility amid growing controversy following a CBS interview. Reports suggest Belichick’s family is concerned about the impact on his legacy. The situation is poised to either fade or escalate, with potential lasting consequences for both Belichick’s career and UNC’s football program.
title: Jordon Hudson, Bill Belichick's girlfriend, banned from UNC facility after controversy

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Neeraj Chopra has postponed the inaugural NC Classic due to the escalating national security situation following Pakistan's aerial attacks on Jammu and other military stations. This decision prioritizes the safety of athletes and stakeholders amidst heightened tensions and retaliatory actions after Operation Sindoor. Chopra emphasized national solidarity, stating that standing with the nation is paramount during this critical time.
title: Neeraj Chopra Classic postponed amid escalating border tensions

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Amidst rising military tensions between India and Pakistan, the IPL 2025 has been suspended for a week. A video surfaced showing Delhi Capitals players, including KL Rahul and Faf du Plessis, relaxing in Uttarakhand. The BCCI cited national security concerns and stakeholder interests as reasons for the suspension following recent events.
title: Watch: Delhi Capitals players' river outing in Dharamsala goes viral

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India's air defence systems, crucial for protecting against aerial threats, include the S-400, Barak-8, and Akash missiles. Pakistan, heavily reliant on Chinese arms, has inducted HQ-9 series long-range surface-to-air missiles. The Harpy drone, an Israeli-made loitering munition, can target enemy air defences autonomously by detecting radar emissions, posing a threat to these systems.
title: How India shut down Pak's second desperate bid to escalate tensions

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India responded firmly to Pakistan's drone and artillery attacks on May 7 and 8, as confirmed by the Ministry of External Affairs. Pakistan initiated large-scale airspace violations, deploying hundreds of drones across the LoC and International Border. Indian forces retaliated with targeted drone strikes, destroying a Pakistani AD radar.
title: 'Destroyed radar, army positions': How India hit back after Pak's failed attack

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: The Central Consumer Protection Authority has issued notices to thirteen online platforms, including Amazon and Flipkart, for the illegal sale of walkie-talkies. These platforms are failing to provide necessary disclosures regarding licensing requirements and frequency specifications. The CCPA is also drafting guidelines to prevent the illegal sale and use of licensed frequency wireless devices.
title: Govt to Amazon, Flipkart, Meesho & others: Selling these gadgets is 'illegal'

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Bill Gates has accused Elon Musk of endangering the lives of the world's poorest children. Gates criticized Musk's decision to shut down USAID through his Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), which he claims has led to life-saving aid expiring and increased cases of diseases like HIV. Gates also highlighted Musk's cancellation of hospital grants, impacting HIV transmission prevention.
title: Bill Gates says Elon Musk is killing the world’s poorest children

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Ministry of external affairs has strongly refuted Pakistan's accusations of Indian forces attacking its own cities, dismissing them as a "deranged fantasy" and disinformation. This denial follows Pakistan's retaliatory actions, including drone and missile attacks on Indian cities, which India claims were a response to Operation Sindoor, targeting terrorist sites.
title: 'Deranged fantasy': MEA rejects Pak's claim India targeting own cities

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'New low': India slams Pak for targeting 'gurdwaras, churches & temples'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma countered Rahul Gandhi's GST criticism, linking it to national security. Sarma defended GST, calling it a 'God-Sent Tax' that funds vital defense acquisitions like Rafale jets and S-400 systems. He emphasized that taxpayer money, collected through GST, strengthens India's security and growth.
title: 'Not Gabbar Singh Tax but God-Sent Tax': Himanta's jab at Cong amid Op Sindoor

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India has accused Pakistan of endangering civilian lives by using passenger planes as shields during a failed drone and missile attack on May 7. Indian officials stated that Pakistan kept its airspace open, using civilian airliners as cover, despite knowing India would retaliate.
title: Pak used unsuspecting civilian planes as shield to launch failed drone attack: India

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Donald Trump suggested potentially reducing tariffs on China to 80% before a weekend meeting, signaling a possible easing of trade war tensions. This proposal comes ahead of discussions in Switzerland focused on de-escalation, not a comprehensive agreement. Trump also highlighted a new trade deal with Britain and urged China to open its markets to the USA.
title: 'Seems right!': Donald Trump floats slashing China tariff to 80%

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India has accused Pakistan of escalating tensions by launching hundreds of Turkish-made drones into Indian airspace, targeting military infrastructure and using civilian airliners as shields. Indian forces intercepted many drones, while Pakistan kept its airspace open, endangering commercial flights. India retaliated with strikes on air defense sites and terror launchpads, citing a prior terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.
title: 'Turkey-made drones, civilian planes as shields': MEA on Pak's failed incursion

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Amid escalating military tensions between India and Pakistan, the IPL 2025 has been suspended, prompting Michael Vaughan to suggest completing the tournament in the UK. With India's Test series against England looming, Vaughan's proposal offers a logistical solution, though the BCCI prioritizes national interest and solidarity with the government during the crisis. The remaining matches' fate remains uncertain.
title: 'We have venues': Ex-Eng captain pitches UK as host for remaining IPL matches

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Tahawwur Rana, accused in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks conspiracy, is now in judicial custody until June 6, 2025, following his extradition from the US. The NIA alleges Rana, a close associate of David Headley, was privy to the terror operation plans. Rana has sought permission to communicate with his family.
title: 26/11 Mumbai attack plotter Rana remanded to judicial custody till June 6

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Bill Gates will donate his wealth through the Gates Foundation. This will happen over the next 20 years. The Gates Foundation will close in 2045. Gates aims to reduce his net worth by 99%. The foundation will focus on global health and poverty. Gates wants to address urgent problems. He hopes to save millions of lives with this accelerated plan.
title: Bill Gates on his 'last chapter,' People will say a lot of things when I die, but...

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Amidst rising tensions, Edelweiss Mutual Fund CEO Radhika Gupta suggests three simple ways for Indian citizens to support the armed forces, including spreading accurate information, being a good national ambassador, and following rules. The IT ministry also issued an advisory for responsible online behavior, urging users to avoid misinformation.
title: Edelweiss CEO shares 3 'little ways' citizens can support Armed Forces

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In a recent press conference, Colonel Sofiya Qureshi revealed that Pakistan launched a massive drone intrusion, sending 300-400 drones across 36 locations from Leh to Sir Creek, targeting Indian military installations. Indian armed forces successfully intercepted many drones using both kinetic and non-kinetic methods.
title: What are Songar drones Pak used to target Indian military sites?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistan's parliament witnessed heated debates as ministers clashed over the government's handling of the escalating conflict with India. MP Shahid Khattak criticized Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif for his perceived inaction and failure to condemn India and Prime Minister Modi. This occurred after India conducted precision strikes in PoK following terror attacks in Jammu and Kashmir.
title: 'Buzdil' PM can't even take Modi's name: Pak MP slams Shehbaz Sharif

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India has proposed significantly reducing its tariff differential with the US to under 4% to secure exemptions from existing and future tariffs. This move aims to boost the $129 billion bilateral trade, currently favoring India with a $45.7 billion surplus.
title: India proposes cutting tariff gap to clinch trade deal with Trump

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amid escalating India-Pakistan tensions, the home ministry has directed states and Union territories to implement civil defence measures under the 1968 Act. This directive follows Pakistani drone and missile strikes in Jammu and Kashmir and Rajasthan, retaliating against India's Operation Sindoor, which targeted terrorist sites after the Pahalgama attack. Indian air defence systems successfully intercepted most threats.
title: 'Invoke emergency powers under civil defence rules': MHA to all states, UTs

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Following security concerns and the suspension of the 2025 Indian Premier League for a week, franchises are arranging for players to return home. Overseas players, particularly anxious after an incident in Dharamsala, will be assisted by the BCCI in their departure. The BCCI has also released a statement expressing solidarity with the nation amidst recent events.
title: IPL 2025 players start dispersing, overseas lot to head back home too

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Tensions escalate as the Indian Armed Forces defuse a projectile in Amritsar following reported Pakistani air strikes along the western border in Jammu and Kashmir and Punjab. The Indian Army responded to ceasefire violations and drone attacks, asserting its commitment to national sovereignty. These events follow heightened tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack and India's subsequent Operation Sindoor.
title: Watch: Indian Army defuses projectile-like object in Amritsar

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Tensions escalate between India and Pakistan as India launches 'Operation Sindoor' targeting terrorist camps in response to the Pahalgam attack, neutralizing over 100 terrorists. Pakistan retaliates with drone and missile strikes, prompting India to counter-attack key military bases. Blackouts, curfews, and air raid warnings grip the region, with the IPL suspended amidst the ongoing conflict.
title: Blackouts, sirens & Pak's failed drone attacks: 10 things that happened in the last 36 hrs

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The BCCI has suspended IPL 2025 for one week, effective immediately, due to recent events. This decision, impacting matches like Lucknow Super Giants versus Royal Challengers Bengaluru, follows concerns from franchisees, broadcasters, and sponsors. The board expressed solidarity with the nation, armed forces, and the government amidst ongoing challenges, prioritising national interest above all else.
title: IPL 2025 suspended for one week with immediate effect, confirms BCCI

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: The Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) received a threatening email on Friday morning, warning of an imminent explosion at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. The stadium, which serves as the home ground for the Delhi Capitals, was scheduled to host an IPL 2025 match between DC and Gujarat Titans on May 11.
title: IPL 2025: 'We will blast your stadium' - DDCA receives threat email

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Following Operation Sindoor, MeitY issued an advisory for Indian internet users, emphasizing responsible online behavior and caution against misinformation. The advisory outlines dos and don'ts, including sharing verified information and avoiding posts inciting violence. The Ministry of Information & Broadcasting has also advised OTT platforms to discontinue content originating from Pakistan in the interest of national security.
title: Operation Sindoor: Govt shares important Dos and Don'ts for internet users

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has made a bizarre claim that Pakistani forces deliberately avoided intercepting Indian drones to conceal strategic military locations. This justification follows India's 'Operation Sindoor,' precision strikes on terrorist spots, and the thwarting of Pakistani drone and missile attacks.
title: Pak def min gives absurd excuse for army's failure to withstand Op Sindoor

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amid escalating tensions with Pakistan, the defence ministry has granted the Army Chief expanded authority to mobilise the Territorial Army. This decision, enabled by Rule 33 of the Territorial Army Rules 1948, allows for the deployment of Territorial Army units to bolster security and support regular army operations across various commands.
title: Govt empowers Army chief to mobilise Territorial Army for support amid India-Pak tensions

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Indian High Commissioner Vikram Doraiswami confronted Pakistan on Sky News, displaying a photograph of Pakistani military officials attending the funeral of terrorists killed in India's Operation Sindoor. He highlighted the presence of UN-designated terrorist Hafiz Abdur Rauf, brother of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief, leading funeral prayers. Doraiswami questioned Pakistan's system of giving state funerals to terrorists, emphasizing the message it sends.
title: 'Look who’s behind him': Indian envoy shows photo as proof of Pak's link to terrorism

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Amid rising India-Pakistan tensions, Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) assured the public that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, or LPG. This statement follows panic buying fueled by social media posts showing long queues at fuel stations, particularly in border states.
title: 'No need to panic': Indian Oil dispels shortage fears as tensions with Pak escalate

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: On the night of May 8, 2025, the BSF successfully thwarted a major infiltration attempt by Pakistan along the International Border in Samba district, Jammu and Kashmir. Simultaneously, the Indian Army reported that Pakistan's armed forces initiated multiple drone and munition attacks along the western border and engaged in numerous ceasefire violations along the LoC.
title: Watch: BSF foils infiltration bid by terrorists along Pakistan border

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following the interception of missiles and drones fired by Pakistan, remnants of a missile were discovered in Punjab's Hoshiarpur. Initial reports suggest the recovered missile might be a Chinese PL-15, potentially launched from a Pakistani JF-17. If confirmed, India could gain valuable insights into its technology, enhancing its defense capabilities and strategic advantage against China.
title: Fully intact, undetonated Chinese PL-15 missile found in Hoshiarpur

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: The Ministry of Information & Broadcasting has issued an advisory to OTT channels in the country as tensions rise between India and Pakistan. The ministry's advisory comes in the backdrop of Operation Sindoor carried by Indian Armed forces on terror sites in Pakistan to avenge the brutal terrorist attack in Pahalgam on April 22. The advisory directs OTT platforms and media streaming services in India to immediately remove content originating from Pakistan.
title: Government advisory to OTT channels: In the interest of national security, immediately discontinue ...

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, states bordering the neighboring country are implementing emergency measures. Delhi has heightened security and cancelled employee leaves, while Punjab, Jammu and Kashmir, Haryana, Rajasthan, and Himachal Pradesh have closed educational institutions following drone attacks.
title: India-Pakistan tensions: What’s closed, emergency protocols & more

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Following the indefinite suspension of the IPL 2025, India's tour of Bangladesh and participation in the Asia Cup later this year are now highly improbable. The BCCI might utilise the August-September window to conclude the IPL if required, even if it means cancelling the scheduled tour and Asia Cup participation.
title: IPL suspended: Which window can be used to complete the remaining 16 matches?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) mocked Pakistan's government after its Economic Affairs Division seemingly appealed for more international loans due to losses from conflict. While Pakistan claimed the account was hacked, Moody's warned that escalating tensions with India could negatively impact Pakistan's growth and financial stability. Moody's anticipates minimal impact on India, except for increased defense spending.
title: PIB trolls Pak with 'Golmaal' jibe as Islamabad seeks 'loans', then retracts

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The IPL 2025 has been suspended due to escalating regional tensions and national security concerns following missile firings by Pakistan. The decision impacts the final 16 matches, with BCCI prioritising player safety after an earlier game postponement and airspace closures. Evacuation efforts are underway, with potential rescheduling options being explored for later in the year.
title: When was the last time IPL stopped midway?

author: AJAY SURA
description: Ambala residents were alerted to a potential attack from Pakistan as air raid sirens blared across the city at 10:22 am, prompting authorities to urge people to stay indoors. This warning follows heightened tensions after Operation Sindoor and mirrors a similar alert in Chandigarh on Friday, which suspended work at the Punjab and Haryana High Court.
title: Air raid sirens blare in Ambala over possible Pakistan attack

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Bill Gates, the tech billionaire, plans to donate 99% of his wealth to the Gates Foundation within 20 years, aiming to dissolve it by 2045. He wants to address urgent global issues, foregoing the label of 'dying rich.' Despite his $168 billion fortune, his children will inherit less than 1% to encourage their own success.
title: Bill Gates to donate 99% of his wealth— What will his children actually inherit?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India-Pakistan tensions impact: Escalating tensions with India pose a significant threat to Pakistan's fragile economic recovery, potentially derailing its IMF bailout program and access to international financing. Pakistan's vulnerability stems from its high external debt, limited foreign exchange reserves, and reliance on international aid.
title: Can Pakistan afford a war with India? Here's a reality check

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: The IPL 2025 has been suspended due to heightened regional tensions between India and Pakistan following missile firings by the latter, all of which were successfully intercepted by the Indian defence forces. The fixture between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals was postponed on Thursday.
title: IPL 2025 suspended as India-Pakistan tensions escalate

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India's S-400 air defense system, known as "Sudarshan Chakra," successfully intercepted a Pakistani offensive involving drones and missiles. S-400 air defence system, with its extensive range and engagement capabilities, neutralised all incoming threats from Pakistan.
title: Pak missile, drone attack foiled: How India's S-400 'Sudarshan Chakra' works

author: CLARA LEWIS
description: Following heightened security concerns and recent drone attacks along the border, Maharashtra has issued 'shoot to kill' orders for unauthorized entries into offshore defense zones. The Fisheries Department urgently warned coastal fishermen to avoid oil rigs and restricted areas, providing no-fishing coordinates.
title: ‘Shoot to kill’ orders issued, Mumbai fishermen warned to stay away from oil rigs

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Indian cricketer Rohit Sharma voiced his support for India's military actions against terror infrastructure in Pakistan, emphasizing national pride and urging caution against fake news. This statement followed India's strikes on terror targets in response to the Pahalgam attack, escalating tensions between the two nations. The match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals in Dharamsala on Thursday was called off due to security concerns following air raid alerts in neighbouring regions, prompting the BCCI to reassess the situation.
title: 'With every decision taken ... ': Rohit Sharma to Indian Forces

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: On May 8-9, 2025, Pakistan's armed forces initiated multiple drone and munition attacks along the western border, accompanied by ceasefire violations along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir. The Indian Army effectively repulsed these attacks, responding firmly with advanced weaponry and air defense systems. India also used S-400 missile systems to neutralize incoming threats.
title: L-70 guns, Schilka, S-400: Weapons India used to intercept Pak drones

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Chopra, the double Olympic medallist in javelin, is set to compete at the Ostrava Golden Spike 2025 athletics meet on June 24 in the Czech Republic. After being forced to withdraw from the past two editions due to injury, he will finally aim to make his debut at the prestigious meet.
title: 'Let's do our part': Neeraj Chopra's powerful message amid rising India-Pakistan tensions

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Pakistan's Economic Affairs Division faced a social media controversy after a post, later claimed to be a hack, appealed for international loans amid escalating tensions with India. This occurred following India's "Operation Sindoor" in response to a terrorist attack, leading to retaliatory strikes and market instability, with the Karachi Stock Exchange plummeting.
title: Pakistan appeals for loans citing 'heavy losses', later says X account hacked

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In a significant escalation, Indian armed forces successfully intercepted and neutralized over 50 swarm drones launched by Pakistan along the Line of Control and International Borders on May 8-9, 2025. The coordinated drone attacks and ceasefire violations were met with a robust response, utilizing advanced air defense systems.
title: S-400, Spyder, Akash: India’s air defence systems explained

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Press Information Bureau's Fact Check Unit has debunked a fake video circulated by Pakistani handles, falsely claiming the destruction of an Indian post. The PIB clarified that the video was staged propaganda, noting the non-existent "20 Raj Battalion.
title: No 'fidayeen' attack, no strike on port: PIB counters fake news flooding social media

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has announced the relocation of the remaining Pakistan Super League (PSL) matches to the United Arab Emirates (UAE). PCB Chair Mohsin Naqvi expressed disappointment that Pakistani fans would miss watching the games live.
title: Pakistan Super League officially relocated to UAE after tensions escalate

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Amid escalating India-Pakistan tensions, IPL chairman Arun Dhumal directed spectators to evacuate the Dharamsala stadium, leading to the abandonment of the Punjab Kings versus Delhi Capitals match. A floodlight failure halted the game after 10.1 overs, despite a dominant 122-run opening partnership by Punjab. Players and staff will now travel to Delhi via a special train from Pathankot. A video now viral on social media captures Arun Dhumal walking onto the field and urging the crowd to exit the stadium immediately.
title: Evacuate now! IPL Chairman rushes onto field during PBKS vs DC match

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Operation Sindoor impact: Indian stock markets are likely to open lower due to escalating India-Pakistan tensions. Indian stock market's reaction to the ongoing India-Pakistan tensions has till now been relatively muted.
title: How will Nifty50, BSE Sensex react to rising India-Pakistan tensions?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Tensions have escalated along the western border as the Indian Army released footage of a Pakistani drone being shot down. This action follows a major assault by Pakistani Armed Forces involving drones, missiles, and ceasefire violations across Jammu and Kashmir. Indian forces repulsed the attacks, responding with force after Operation Sindoor targeted terror camps in retaliation for a prior attack.
title: Watch: Army releases video of its strong response to Pak amid drone attacks

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: On the night of May 8-9, 2025, the Indian Army successfully intercepted and downed over 50 Pakistani swarm drones attempting to breach the LoC and International Borders. This comprehensive counter-drone operation involved advanced weaponry and specialized counter-UAS equipment across multiple sectors. The attacks followed Indian precision strikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir under 'Operation Sindoor'.
title: Army foils Pakistan attempts to send swarm drones across LoC

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Following heightened tensions and India's response to terror attacks, Jammu experienced explosions and a blackout early Friday, with security forces neutralizing threats. Simultaneously, Punjab and Rajasthan enforced blackouts amid reports of drone activity and explosions, prompting heightened security measures and investigations.
title: Drones, blackouts and sirens: What happened overnight in Jammu, Punjab and Rajasthan

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Analysts have adjusted their outlook on several companies. Investec lowered Punjab National Bank's target due to weak margins, while Morgan Stanley remains cautious on Dabur due to margin erosion and weak domestic revenue. Conversely, Citi is optimistic about MGL, raising its target price.
title: PNB, Dabur, Voltas: Top stocks on brokers' radar today

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following escalating tensions, Virender Sehwag and Shikhar Dhawan voiced strong support for the Indian Armed Forces after Pakistan launched missiles targeting key areas, all of which were successfully intercepted. Explosions and drone interceptions were reported in Jammu and Kashmir and Rajasthan, leading to blackouts in several regions. These events follow India’s Operation Sindoor, a response to a prior terror attack.
title: 'War has been chosen by Pakistan'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The IPL match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals was abandoned midway due to air raid alerts in Jammu and Pathankot. Punjab Kings were at 122 for 1 when the stadium was evacuated. Anti-Pakistan slogans were heard amidst the panic. Players and staff will be transported to Delhi via a special train.
title: 'Darein toh Pakistan waale darein': Crowd's roar after IPL match abandoned

author: ATUL THAKUR AND REMA NAGARAJAN
description: Official data reveals a significant undercount of Covid-19 deaths in India during 2021. Excess deaths, calculated by comparing registered deaths to pre-pandemic projections, were about 20 lakh, six times higher than the official Covid death toll of 3.3 lakh. States like Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, and West Bengal showed the highest discrepancies, while Kerala and a few others had the least.
title: India logged 19.7L excess deaths in 2021, 6x official Covid toll: Government data

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2' is performing well at the box office. The movie is close to earning Rs 100 crore in India. After eight days, the film has collected Rs 95.65 crore. 'Raid 2' saw a slight increase on Thursday. The film stars Ajay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh. Raj Kumar Gupta directed the movie.
title: ‘Raid 2’ collection: Ajay Devgn starrer inches towards Rs 100 crore

author: VAIBHAV GANJAPURE
description: The Nagpur bench of the Bombay High Court has firmly asserted a woman's right to bodily autonomy, stating that any sexual act after a woman refuses constitutes rape, regardless of prior relationships or perceived morality. This ruling upheld the conviction of three men in a 2014 gang rape case in Chandrapur, emphasizing that a woman's past or character is irrelevant in determining consent, reinforcing that 'No' means 'No'.
title: No means no: High court affirms sexual act without woman’s nod is rape

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: Following the recent attack in Pahalgam, the Indian government has heightened security measures at all airports and flights nationwide. The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) has mandated secondary ladder point security checks for all passengers and prohibited visitor entry to terminals. Additional measures include increased surveillance, strict monitoring of aircraft operations, and thorough scrutiny of passenger and cargo manifests to prevent any untoward incidents.
title: Airport security at highest level: Pre-boarding checks for flyers

author: TNN
description: World Bank President Ajay Banga assured India that the agency will not interfere in the Indus Water Treaty, which India has paused amidst tensions with Pakistan. Banga clarified the World Bank's role is limited to facilitating dispute resolution through neutral experts or arbitrators, as per the treaty's provisions. He met with PM Modi and Finance Minister Sitharaman to discuss the matter.
title: Ajay Banga meets PM, says World Bank won't interfere in Indus Water Treaty issue

author: TNN
description: Following heightened tensions, Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat are fortifying their Pakistan frontier, implementing nightly blackouts, curfews, and mass leave cancellations for essential personnel. Rajasthan faces power outages and movement restrictions, while schools and universities are closed. Punjab suspends ceremonies at Wagah and prepares shelters as panic buying surges. Gujarat heightens alert in border districts after a drone sighting, initiating evacuation plans for vulnerable villages.
title: Blackouts, curfews, no leave, no lapse: Full-scale emergency mode at borders

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: BCCI is in a huddle after the match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals was called off midway due to the cross-border tensions. The players and spectators were asked to evacuate the venue immediately and now the Indian cricket board has planned a special train to get the players, support staff and broadcast crew to safe zone.
title: 'Bombs are coming': Cheerleader's terrifying video from PBKS vs DC match

author: RAJ SHEKHAR JHA
description: Pakistan's elaborate deception to shield Sajid Mir, a key LeT operative involved in the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, has resurfaced. Initially declared dead to evade international scrutiny, Mir was later resurrected and imprisoned under pressure. This duplicity highlights Pakistan's attempts to mislead global forums like FATF and conceal its support for terrorism, as India reminds the world of Islamabad's deceitful tactics.
title: 'Dead-alive' narrative on 26/11 plotter left Pak exposed

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: Amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, the US, EU, Iran, and Saudi Arabia are urging de-escalation and dialogue. US Secretary of State Rubio spoke with counterparts in both nations, while India's Jaishankar affirmed the nation's resolve to counter any Pakistani escalation firmly. Despite global calls for restraint, India emphasizes its measured response to cross-border terrorism following the Pahalgam attack.
title: End support to terrorist groups, US secretary of state Rubio tells Pak PM

author: TNN
description: Following strikes and counter-strikes, J&K, Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat heightened border security with Pakistan, imposing blackouts and curfews. Schools and colleges shut down across J&K, while Rajasthan adjusted blackout timings and sealed its border. Punjab ordered lights out indefinitely, and drone attacks were reported and neutralized, escalating tensions and prompting safety measures.
title: Extended blackouts, curfews: Borderlands in emergency mode

author: TNN
description: Col Sofiya Qureshi, who recently briefed the media on India's airstrikes, was previously highlighted in a 2020 Supreme Court judgment granting permanent commission to women officers. The court, recognizing women's contributions to the armed forces, specifically mentioned Qureshi's distinguished service, including leading an Indian Army contingent at a multinational exercise and her UN peacekeeping role in Congo.
title: In SC verdict on PC to women officers, Sofiya figured at top

author: TNN
description: India's executive director at the IMF will present the nation's stance at a board meeting concerning a proposed $1.3 billion loan to Pakistan. India urges IMF board members to deeply consider the facts, given Pakistan's history with bailout programs. The government is also pushing for a review of funds to Pakistan by other multilateral agencies.
title: India to seek checks on IMF loans to Pakistan at meet today

author: TNN
description: Pakistani officials are facing scrutiny for contradictory statements regarding terrorism and military actions, prompting India's foreign secretary to note their inadvertent support of India's position. Defence Minister Khawaja Asif admitted Pakistan's involvement in supporting terrorism for three decades, while other ministers made conflicting claims about terrorist camps and military engagements.
title: India's hit-back scrambles Pak brains, mins cut sorry figure

author: RAJAT PANDIT
description: India boasts a superior, multi-layered air defense system compared to Pakistan, integrating Russian S-400s, Israeli systems, and indigenous Akash missiles. The S-400, with its extensive range and advanced capabilities, significantly outclasses Pakistan's Chinese HQ-9. India is further enhancing its defenses with the development of Project Kusha and integration of military and civilian radars for a unified air picture.
title: Led by S-400, Indian air defence far better than Pak's

author: TNN
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh issued a stern warning to Pakistan, asserting India's readiness to take any necessary action to defend its sovereignty. He highlighted the successful strikes on terror camps in Punjab and POK, praising the armed forces for their precision and avoidance of civilian casualties. Singh also emphasized the government's commitment to defence self-reliance under PM Modi's leadership.
title: No limit we cannot cross to defend sovereignty: Rajnath Singh

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: India has strongly refuted Pakistan's allegation of targeting the Neelum-Jhelum hydropower project in POK during recent military strikes, warning of severe repercussions if Pakistan uses this claim as a pretext for attacking Indian infrastructure. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri accused Pakistan of disinformation and supporting cross-border terrorism, highlighting the Pahalgam attack and linking it to communal rhetoric.
title: Pahalgam was original escalation: Foreign secretary Vikram Misri

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: Following the closure of 27 airports in north India due to escalating tensions with Pakistan, flights are facing longer routes and potential diversions to more distant airports like Mumbai and Ahmedabad. Airlines are bypassing Pakistani airspace, causing congestion on routes via Mumbai. Indian carriers have relocated aircraft and crew from the affected airports, with IndiGo moving planes from Chandigarh.
title: With 27 airports shut, diverted flights set to get even longer
